title: Emily Miller Bonney received her Ph.D. in Ancient Art and Archaeology from the Institute of Fine Arts, New York University. Her research focuses on Bronze Age Crete and the application of methods from phenomenology, landscape archaeology, and other theoretical approaches

Patricia Murrieta-Flores holds a European Research Council post-doctoral position at the University of Lancaster and is member of the Archaeological Computing Research Group at the University of Southampton. She specializes in spatial technologies, GIS, high-performance computing, and other applications of technology to archaeological and historical research. She is co-director, field supervisor and scientific adviser to several archaeological projects in Spain and Mexico
